CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Displayed in Exhibition stage positioned above or below the Shortlisted for Acquisition stage?
SRP.A: The Displayed in Exhibition stage is positioned {above} the Shortlisted for Acquisition stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Institutionally Acquired?
VE.A: The value of stage Institutionally Acquired is {13%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Submitted for Review?
VE.A: The value of stage Submitted for Review is {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Submitted for Review, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Institutionally Acquired, with a value of {13%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to stage Eligible for Acquisition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to stage Eligible for Acquisition is {18%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 54%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Submitted for Review} stage has {100%}, the {Approved for Exhibition} stage has {82%}, the {Displayed in Exhibition} stage has {63%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 54%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stage has {45%}, the {Eligible for Acquisition} stage has {27%}, the {Institutionally Acquired} stage has {13%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 36% and 72%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Displayed in Exhibition} stage has {63%}, the {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stage has {45%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, or from stage Submitted for Review to Approved for Exhibition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Approved for Exhibition} to {Displayed in Exhibition} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Eligible for Acquisition to Institutionally Acquired, from stage Submitted for Review to Approved for Exhibition, or from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to Eligible for Acquisition?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {Eligible for Acquisition} to {Institutionally Acquired}, {Submitted for Review} to {Approved for Exhibition}, and {Shortlisted for Acquisition} to {Eligible for Acquisition} are equal.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Approved for Exhibition} and {Displayed in Exhibition} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Eligible for Acquisition} and {Institutionally Acquired} stages.
